Description: Body sherd of North Ionian or Aeolian pottery bowl. Glazed inside; outside, frieze of short tongues at rim; in handle zone, volute and lotus bud preserved from larger vegetal composition; two bands below.
Curator's comments: Possibly from same bowl as Louvre AM1362(43).

Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 3, N 9)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 37, no. B 2a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.30)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: B 2a (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
Miscellaneous number: T.2904 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
